headline: Sonny Grosso, 89, Dies; Detective Severed ‘French Connection’
abstract: He and his partner broke the heroin case that inspired that 1971 film. After he retired, he became a movie and television producer and consultant.
lead_paragraph: Sonny Grosso, the true-blue New York City police detective who with his gung-ho partner made the record heroin bust that inspired the Oscar-winning film “The French Connection,” died on Jan. 22 at his home in Manhattan. He was 89.
